posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
1. Signal already has a side to side ‘swipable rail’ to select an attachement (at least on android it does). That works well in my opinion. Let’s keep it that way.

  2. What is not yet possible is selecting multiple attachements and adding them to the preview message. The concept for that is rather simple; instead of inmidiatly adding the attachment when an item has been clicked, only select the item and add a checkmark, and allow the user to make other selections aswell. When the user is done making selections, he closes the attachment selection menu, and the attachements are at taht point added to the concept message.

  3. It is also not yet possible to select multiple items in another app, and pass them on all at once to signal, as a group of attchements (Android gallery, file manager etc.).

  4. Also, at this time Signal supports all sorts of files as attachements (great!), but only the images can be selected in a ‘swipable rail’. All other types open a different app. We might want to come up with a more universal attachement selection method, possibly only a rail of previews just like with images right now.

  5. And finally, it would be nice to have a group of recent items to choose from, without distinction in type of file. Just show a rail of previews in the order of most recent to least recent.

posts.cooked:
@jlund why this commit is not added ?

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android

Change notification URI to support multi-attachment messages.

committed 06:41PM - 14 Mar 18 UTC
greysonp
+30 -6

The previous code where were listened on the message itself to get attachment up…dates works in a world where attachments and messages are 1:1. However, we're preparing for many:1, so I made a new URI scheme.

link_counts.title: Change notification URI to support multi-attachment messages. · signalapp/Signal-Android@756824b · GitHub

posts.cooked:
Meteor0id:

What is not yet possible is selecting multiple attachements and adding them to the preview message.

This is very needed I think, because selecting one attachment per image becomes tedious quickly. Perhaps in the past this worked fine, but I noticed that when getting attachments it’s often multiple related files rather than a single one.

But then again I don’t need to say that because in 2014 there was already an issue made for this. Luckily it turns out that a volunteer already made a PR for it here. Now we just have to hope that someone from the project looks at that PR for implementing this feature.

posts.cooked: PR declined

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
Meteor0id:

And finally, it would be nice to have a group of recent items to choose from, without distinction in type of file. Just show a rail of previews in the order of most recent to least recent.

I should add that this should probably be an option which can be disabled under settings. Some users might not want Signal to keep a record of files which have recently been shared with someone over signal.
This feature is very important and i want that.

posts.name: Stephan
posts.cooked: This would be such an essential feature, I really really hope it will be implemented soon!

Absolutely, I can only second that. Recently faced this issue again, when I only got sent one or two pictures of my parents’ vacation each day (out of 20 or 30 a day all their WhatsApp contacts got), because selecting each and every single picture was such a pain in the ass for them… it’s cumbersome.

posts.name: JF
posts.cooked: That would be awesome indeed! Just like @PiCob said, I need to use Whatsapp every time I need to send more than 3/4 pictures in a row.
Multiple attachments per message is undoubtedly the way to go here.

posts.name: Alex Sim
posts.cooked: It is particularly frustrating to have multiple images to send to someone, and have to send them as single messages. It is also something a lot of people complain about when comparing to the likes of WhatsApp - Would be much appreciated to have mutliple attachments per message.
And it would also save the recipient from getting 20 notifications one after another (like in case of vacation pictures, family pictures)…

I could not find this topic in the archive. Maybe, it is/was already active.
Sometimes, I want to send serveral images to someone at once, but I can send (select) only one picture in a gallery. It would be sooo nice to add this feature, because it is very annoying to add picture by picture to be send.

regards
Thomas
Threema does this well, and has done it for as long as I can remember.

posts.name: Alexander Sibert
posts.cooked: I miss this feature because i sending sometimes a lot of photos.

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
catopuma:

I miss this feature because i sending sometimes a lot of photos.

Please use the like button for comments like this ;)
But thanks for supporting the idea.
What are the barriers for not implementing that feature ?
please. I have literally a large group of people depending on this feature… Any dev can comment on the status?

anon57494327:

What are the barriers for not implementing that feature ?

In my opinion the greatest barrier must be the increased server load and thus the stability of the service. Signal does not have (yet) the capacity of other big messengers. They need to think about scaling up the user base as well as the server set up.
That being said, I also hope they will implement sending multiple photos at once some time soon!

But most people send images one by one without any time gap and face no issue, so i don’t think that servers can’t handle multiple images. If servers can’t handle multiple images at once then why one by one images are continuously sending without any service problem.
